alert.note: Alert for Big Island East; Big Island Interior; Big Island North; Big Island Southeast; Big Island Summit; Kohala; Kona (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 18 at 5:29PM HST until further notice by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON FOR MAUI COUNTY AND THE BIG ISLAND... ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON FOR OAHU AND KAUAI... ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Maui, Molokai, Lanai, Kahoolawe, and the Big Island. * WHEN...Through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Flood prone roads and other low lying areas may be closed due to elevated runoff and overflowing streams. Urban areas may receive more significant flooding and property damage due to rapid runoff. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Tropical Storm Calvin will produce periods of heavy rainfall over Maui and Hawaii Counties starting this evening through Wednesday afternoon. Excessive rainfall may lead to flooding conditions and landslides over steep terrain, especially along east and southeast facing slopes.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Big Island East; Big Island Interior; Big Island North; Big Island Southeast; Big Island Summit; Kohala; Kona
